title: Pressure on Companies to Commit Securities Fraud
itunes:title: Pressure on Companies to Commit Securities Fraud
description:
James Park, a Professor at UCLA Law School, discusses the 20th anniversary of the landmark Sarbanes Oxley Act and his new book: "The Valuation Treadmill: How Securities Fraud Threatens the Integrity of Public Companies," which describes the pressure on public companies to commit securities fraud.

June Grasso hosts.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.
